thread.title: Best Air Travel Advice from Another 7 About.com Travel Experts
thread.title_full: Best Air Travel Advice from Another 7 About.com Travel Experts

author: By Benet Wilson
title: Best Air Travel Advice from Another 7 About.com Travel Experts
text:
I’m not just the About.com Air Travel Expert -- I’m also a big fan and user of the site. I did a previous post, “Best Air Travel Advice from 7 About.com Travel Experts,” but the information keeps coming from this talented group. So below are more tips you can use from the About Travel Experts.
1. Budget Travel I’m a girl who loves to travel, but who also likes to save a dollar, a peso or a Euro. In the post “5 Great Destinations for Flight and Hotel Packages,” Budget Travel Expert Mark Kahler shows where the best flight/hotel package deals are, including Cancun, the Caribbean and Orlando. More »
A seat on a Gulfstream GIV. Photo by Benet J. Wilson 2. Flying in Luxury We go from budget to luxury with Expert Karen Tina Harrison. I’ve been fortunate enough fly on private jets several times in my life (including a ride on a Gulfstream IV that was owned by Oprah Winfrey), and Harrison nails the experience perfectly in her post, “ What to Expect When You Fly on Private Jets.” More »
Photo courtesy of British Airways 3. Business Travel Business Travel Expert Emily Saladino is someone after my own heart. As someone who spends way too much time flying coach. Saladino’s post -- Best Coach Cabins for Business Travelers -- offers a list of global carriers that are showing the love to those of us sitting in the back of the bus. I offered my own take on this in “Amazing Amenities In Coach You Won’t Believe Airlines Give Away.” More »
Abel Mitja Varela/E+/Getty Images 4. Travel Insurance and Safety As a regular traveler and aviation journalist, I know more than the average bear about Federal Aviation Administration rules and regulations (and I have them bookmarked on my smartphone), so it’s harder for crewmembers to throw out "FAA regulations" when they want to stop me from doing something that’s perfectly legal. But it can be a slippery slope, which is why this post by Travel Insurance and Safety Expert Joe Cortez -- “ Can A Picture Prevent You From Travel” -- explains what can happen if you’re caught taking photos on your next flight. More »
5. Washington, D.C. Travel I’m an Air Force brat whose dad was assigned to the Pentagon while I was in high school, which is how I ended up living in the nation’s capital. One of the most exciting things for me in D.C. is the air show at Andrews Air Force Base, home of Air Force One and the military’s best jets. It was a show I loved attending. D.C. Expert Rachel Cooper offers a great guide -- “Andrews Air Show 2015” -- to the 2015 air show set for September. More »
Image Source/Getty Images 6. Honeymoons/Romantic Travel Expert When my sister got married, I helped her pack for her honeymoon to Hawaii. My sister is what one would call high maintenance, packing a large suitcase just for her shoes. She had me, but for those of you who don’t, Expert Susan Breslow Sardone offers a great cheat sheet -- “ Carry-on Bags Size and Weight Limits” -- that can help ensure that you don’t overpack and get hit with extra baggage fees. speaking of, I have my own post on how to avoid paying those pesky fees . More »
7. Student Travel My friends know that I was one of those people who scoffed at those who brought those silly-looking neck pillows aboard their flights. But Student Travel Expert Lauren Juliff offers the pros and cons of inflight pillows and offers options on which ones to buy. In my own post, “ Five Items That Can Upgrade Your Air Travel,” one of those items is a neck pillow. More »
